intro: Gossypium divaricatum, commonly known as the narrow-leaf cotton or narrowleaf cotton, is a species of flowering plant in the mallow family, Malvaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas, particularly in areas with warm, humid climates. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically pink to reddish in color and produce fluffy, white cotton-like fibers that are harvested for textile use. Gossypium divaricatum is valued for its fiber quality and is cultivated in various parts of the world for commercial cotton production.
